name: Chraibi.GitHub.io
body:
### About
I am a post-doc at [Forschungszentrum JÃ¼lich](http://www.fz-juelich.de).
My research topic is pedestrian dynamics, focusing on the development of mathematical models to describe the motion of pedestrians.

In November 2008 I completed my studies at [Hamburg University of Technology](http://www.tu-harburg.de/). The subject of my [Diploma Thesis](http://juwel.fz-juelich.de:8080/dspace/handle/2128/3663) was titled: "Ordinary Differential Equations to Describe Pedestrian Dynamics" (German).  In my [PhD thesis](http://juser.fz-juelich.de/record/21705) (May 2012 at the institute of theoretical physics in Cologne University) I investigated validated force-based models for pedestrian dynamics. 

### Teaching
At the department [Computer Simulation for Fire Safety and Pedestrian Traffic](http://www.asim.uni-wuppertal.de/en.html) in the University of Wuppertal I have some educational activities. Besides, supervising PhD/master/bachelor students I give the following lectures:
 
- "Informatics for engineers" (Summer)
- "Pedestrian Dynamics" (Winter)

### Projects
[Here](http://www.fz-juelich.de/ias/jsc/EN/Research/ModellingSimulation/CivilSecurityTaraffic/Projects/_node.html) is 
a collection of projects, where I contributed to in one way or another. 

Actually, my main focus lays in the development of [JuPedSim](http://jupedsim.github.io/jpscore/); a framework to model, simulate and analyze pedestrian dynamics.  

### Publications

An updated list of my publications can be found [here](http://www.fz-juelich.de/ias/jsc/EN/AboutUs/Staff/personalItems/chraibi_m-publications.html?nn=362224)
